required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcomes of Patients Who Survived Treatment on an Intensive Care Unit for COVID-19 in England and Wales
clinical_study.official_title: Outcomes of Patients Who Survived Treatment on an Intensive Care Unit for COVID-19 in England and Wales: a Comparative Retrospective Cohort Study (OPTIC-19)

collaborator.agency: Intensive Care National Audit & Research Centre

brief_summary.textblock: This retrospective cohort study aims to characterise outcomes for patients treated on an intensive care unit (ICU) with COVID-19 in England and Wales, one year after discharge from hospital. Outcomes will be compared with patients admitted as an emergency to an ICU for other conditions. The study will use existing national audit data linked to routine healthcare datasets.

secondary_outcome.measure: Emergency hospital admission for respiratory infection
secondary_outcome.description: Emergency hospital admission for respiratory infection

secondary_outcome.measure: Emergency hospital admission for a major adverse cardiac event
secondary_outcome.description: Emergency hospital admission for a major adverse cardiac event (myocardial infarction, stroke, heart failure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Emergency hospital admission for a venous thrombotic event
secondary_outcome.description: Emergency hospital admission for a venous thrombotic event (deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism)

secondary_outcome.measure: Development of end stage renal failure
secondary_outcome.description: Development of end stage renal failure treated by renal replacement therapy

arm_group.description: Patients admitted to an adult (16 years or over), general ICU in England or Wales as an emergency with confirmed COVID-19 between 1st January to 1st July 2020.
Patients admitted to an adult (16 years or over), general ICU in England or Wales as an emergency without confirmed COVID-19 between 1st July 2016 and 1st July 2020.

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to an adult (16 years or over), general ICU in England or Wales as an emergency between 1st July 2016 and 1st July 2020 who survived to hospital discharge.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 16 years or over
- Admitted to an adult, general ICU in England or Wales as an emergency (unplanned)
- Admitted to ICU for either: a) confirmed COVID-19 between 1st January to 1st July 2020 or b) without confirmed COVID-19 between 1st July 2016 and 1st July 2020-
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who died in hospital after treatment on an ICU

facility.name: Critical Care Research Group, Nuffield Department of Clinical Neurosciences, University of Oxford

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data will not be made publicly available due to privacy and legal implications.
